title: Fresh install, patching freezes computer.
body:
Decided to reinstall today after having not played in a good number of years. Downloaded the client from the website, installed it, logged in and let it patch.

After it patches for an inconsistent amount of time, it seems to cause some sort of failure with my Hard Drives. The patches download fine, but once it switches to "Applying Patches," it steadily uses anywhere from 80% to 50% of the drive's transfer rate until the rate just tanks to 1-0% and sits there. At this point, no other program on the PC will run properly, or start, and Windows itself will begin to fail. Closing the client solves nothing, as whatever it has done lingers after it has been closed. If the client is left open, after a few minutes the transfer rate on both of my hard drives will suddenly spike up to 90% at which point the PC completely freezes and the only way out of it is a hard reset.

I've attempted running the program as administrator, and in compatibility for Windows 7. I'm currently running Windows 10 Home, attempting to install LoL onto a 1TB second Hard Drive with Windows installed on a primary SSD.

I tried looking around for this but Google and these forums don't seem to purge any results related to LoL technical support that aren't YEARS old, so I've had no luck locating any relevant information. Is there any known solution for this?

I am having the same issue. Completely freezes my build (my PC). I run windows 7 (64 bit). I run it as admin.

It really sounds like something's not quite right with the way your pc is trying to download those patches. it might be caused by some leftover processes bogging down your pc, or it could be something more like corrupted Windows files (but hopefully not!!!). Let's take a couple steps to make sure we cover all our bases, and let me know if this doesn't seem to help narrow down the issue.

- [Use the System File Checker (SFC)](https://www.lifewire.com/how-to-use-sfc-scannow-to-repair-windows-system-files-2626161
) to scan for corrupted Windows files and replace/restore them
- You can also scan your hard drive to check for any errors or corrupted file clusters.   [There's a handy guide listed here for Windows 7, 8 and 10.](https://www.howtogeek.com/howto/windows-vista/guide-to-using-check-disk-in-windows-vista/)

No corrupted files, or hard drive errors. I didn't expect to run into either as this machine is just barely over a year old, so hardware failures at this point would be extremely rare.

Also, just to note, I use Avast! for virus scanning, but actively ensure that all of it's shield components are disabled, so as far as I can tell there shouldn't be any conflicts between it and the Riot Launcher, as that would require it bypassing the fact that it's protections are effectively disabled.

Hmmmmmm even with Avast turned off, there could still be something causing it to block League for some reason. I don't want you to risk uninstalling it and putting yourself at risk without a second opinion though. Let's get you in touch with our tech guys in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) who are much more knowledgeable about these kinds of things!

OK, here is how i managed to** solve this problem**.

I had your same issues and tryed to restart pc, install LoL again, searching for Windows Corrupted files but nothing until i took one more chance with this things done.

1) Close **explorer.exe**
This was a big change, giving me 15/20% extra work done before crashing. Morover, when explorer crashed your desktop starts behaving in a strange way, impacting your application aswell.

2) Uninstall **Avast **and turning off the **Firewall**.
Avast was using a lot of CPU while downloading and it was useless work done because we know LoL's patching isn't harmful.
And besides CPU's workload, maybe it was actually interfering with the client, i don't really know.

3) Set PC's fans to **100%**, **cool down your room ** (turn off heating and open your windows) and open your case's **side cover**
This was done because my cpu was reaching >80 celsius while patching and i thought that i could be one of the causes of the problem.

4) Close all **unnecessary programms** and just **go for it.**

P.S.
When you close the explorer your desktop's icons will go away. Open the "Run" window and just browse for the .exe file.
Maybe some of the steps above are useless, but it worked out for me with this combination.

**I'm no tech guy**, just your average nerd trying to reach diamond, so don't take this for granted!
